==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=斗|t2=鬭|alt=鬦,鬪,闘}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etyl}}
{{liushu|p}} — two clenched fists.

{{lang|zh|鬥}} and {{lang|zh|鬭}} are original characters of this form; all others are later corruptions.

Simplified form {{zh-l|*斗}} is via the variant form {{zh-l|*鬦}}.

===Etymology===
Conflation of two roots "to fight" and "to meet", and the merger has been attested since ancient times.

"To fight": Probably from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*daw||to defy, interfere, be at enmity with}}, which is the source of {{cog|bo|སྡོ||to bear up against, bid defiance}} and {{cog|my|တော့||to resent an insinuation, interfere in a quarrel}}.

"To meet": Schuessler (2007) considers this cognate with {{zh-l|*注|to apply; to be touched; to bring together; to join}}; see there for more.
